reviews.text:
Really enjoyed our stay here. The staff at the front desk were super kind and helpful from check-in to check-out. The location is great, right in Le quartier Latin, walking distance to metro stations and buses and plenty of sights. Our room was pretty small, but that’s Paris for you, and it came with a nice view over Place de la Sorbonne. The area is quiet but still close to everything, which made it perfect for exploring the city.
We didn’t have breakfast in the hotel so can’t comment on that.

My husband and I stayed at the Select Hotel this August and had a pleasant experience. We were upgraded to an Executive Room, and the view of the Sorbonne from our window was truly impressive.

The location is excellent, surrounded by bookstores, close to the Luxembourg Gardens, and within walking distance of many attractions. The Latin Quarter itself is full of lively restaurants and bars, but during August it felt calm at night. I’m not sure if that would still be the case once the student crowds return in September.

The room was quite small, which is typical for Paris, and the hotel does not provide daily water bottles. We decided not to get breakfast at the hotel since there are so many great cafés and brunch spots nearby.

Overall, the Select Hotel is clean, cozy, and best suited for travelers who plan to spend most of their time exploring the city and need a comfortable place to sleep. The location and the view made our stay especially enjoyable.

Charming, Thoughtful, and Well-Located

We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful throughout, which made us feel very welcome. The location was perfect—tucked away in a quieter part of Paris, which we appreciated after spending time in some of the busier neighborhoods. That said, the walls are a bit thin, so we did occasionally hear nearby neighbors, but it wasn’t a major issue.

One of the things I truly appreciated was the hotel’s commitment to sustainability. It was clear that being environmentally conscious is part of their ethos, which made our stay feel even more thoughtful.

If I could make one suggestion, it would be to add a self-service water and ice station for refilling water bottles. We had to ask each time, and while the staff were kind, I could tell it wasn’t the most convenient setup for them either.

The decor and overall style of the hotel were beautiful—modern, tasteful, and very Parisian. The air conditioning was a huge plus during our summer stay, and we were so thankful to have it.

All in all, it’s a lovely spot with great vibes, and I would absolutely recommend staying here!

Great hotel in the Latin Quarter that’s central to many of the major things in Paris. Service was superb and all staff were very friendly. The courtyard was very convenient with a few nice restaurants and a coffee shop on the corner. The breakfast was basic but good, but I’d say better (and cheaper) options are available in the courtyard spots. Overall excellent hotel and would recommend to anyone coming to Paris!

This is absolutely the cutest boutique hotel in the Latin Quarter. We walked from the hotel to the Louvre and to Notre Dame as well as many other places. The staff were so helpful and spoke English as well as many other languages. We were quite impressed with the hotel staff. They also gave us great food recommendations. The room was comfortable and quiet as well. We also appreciated the cold ice water, cookies, and candy bar in the lobby. Definitely a great place to stay!
